snippet: Despite receiving positive press attention, Homicide Watch, the Web site that tracked every murder in Washington D.C., is on hiatus and seeking funds to continue.
abstract: David Carr The Media Equation column on Homicide Watch, Web site that tracked every murder in Washington DC; notes site is on hiatus and seeking funds to continue, despite receiving positive press attention, while big chunks of money have gone to The Washington Post and The Los Angeles Times; calls for new answers to dilemma confronting media, not stopgap funds for legacy approaches.
lead_paragraph: Despite receiving positive press attention, Homicide Watch, the Web site that tracked every murder in Washington D.C., is on hiatus and seeking funds to continue.

headline.seo: Innovation in Journalism Goes Begging for Support
headline.main: Innovation in Journalism Goes Begging for Support
headline.print_headline: Innovation In Journalism Goes Begging For Support
